abstract.p: Five advertising agencies share top honors for new-media advertising, winning most of awards at ceremony sponsored by One Club for Art and Copy; some winners noted; Goodby, Silverstein & Partners takes top honors at annual FCS Portfolio Awards for financial advertising; some other winners listed; awards are sponsored by Financial Communications Society (Advertising column) (S)

block.p: Agencies have been honored at two awards ceremonies.
Five agencies shared top honors for new-media advertising, winning the most awards at a ceremony Tuesday night in New York sponsored by the One Club for Art and Copy.
Agencies have been honored at two awards ceremonies.
Five agencies shared top honors for new-media advertising, winning the most awards at a ceremony Tuesday night in New York sponsored by the One Club for Art and Copy.

The agencies, which won three awards apiece at the One Show Interactive ceremony, were: Deepend in London; Elephant Seven in Hamburg, Germany; Euro RSCG DSW Partners in Salt Lake City, part of the Euro RSCG Worldwide unit of Havas Advertising; Oven Digital in New York; and the Sapient Corporation in San Francisco. Arnold Communications in Boston, part of Snyder Communications, which is being acquired by Havas, won Best of Show for an integrated branding campaign for Volkswagen.

And Goodby, Silverstein & Partners in San Francisco, part of the Omnicom Group, took top honors last week at the sixth annual FCS Portfolio Awards ceremony for financial advertising, winning Best of Show for work for the E*Trade Group as well as the most awards, five, all for work for E*Trade. Tierney & Partners in Philadelphia, part of True North Communications, followed with three awards, all for work for Deloitte Consulting, part of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu International. The awards are sponsored by the Financial Communications Society in New York.
